channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Damaged lime bike abandoned, 6th July
item.description:
Multiple lime bikes around Lower belvedere (near Asda) and one in Dylan road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Road, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter accumulating within tree protection screening, 6th July
item.description:
Please, Islington Council, provide an opening at the bottom of the metallic screening around trees for the removal of litter which people put in through the open top. It's so ugly to see litter accumulating outside this large impressive office building named 160 Old St, and I know this exists widely around when the public is given no chance to remove it nor do council street cleaning staff do anything about it. The same problem exists in Hackney, where I live.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 160, Old Street, Finsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very overgrown hedge covering pavement, 6th July
item.description:
As reported before, which Greenwich council keep saying is fixed and it hasn’t been. There is a hedge covering the pavement on the corner of the A2 and Stratheden Road. This is a blind corner for traffic and anyone with a pushchair or wheelchair would have to go into the road to get around it. It needs urgent attention before someone is seriously injured having to step into the road. See attached photos.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Shooters Hill Road, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More apparent flytipping at bins, 6th July
item.description:
The bins outside big Marchwood have a lot of material dumped next to them from a flat renovation, including a bath. Is this flytipping or am I missing some information about legitimate waste removal for this sort of thing?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marchwood Close, Peckham, London
